H0.text: Who published a 1754 book of his designs entitled ‘The Gentleman and Cabinet-Maker’s Director’. Thomas Chippendale

H1.text: Who published a 1754 book of his designs entitled ‘The Gentleman and Cabinet-Maker’s Director’. George Hepplewhite

H2.text: Who published a 1754 book of his designs entitled ‘The Gentleman and Cabinet-Maker’s Director’. Robert Adam

H3.text: Who published a 1754 book of his designs entitled ‘The Gentleman and Cabinet-Maker’s Director’. Chippendale chair

A4.text: In 1754 he published a book of his designs in a trade catalogue titled The Gentleman and Cabinet Maker's Director

A5.text: After working as a journeyman cabinet maker in London, during 1754, he became the first cabinet-maker to publish a book of his designs, titled The Gentleman and Cabinet Maker's Director
